name: Songlines on Screen
description:
Songlines on Screen is a series of 7 short films that have been made to record, celebrate, and share precious historic and cultural information from Indigenous groups in remote western, northern, and central Australia. The film screening joins the larger exhibition ‘Walking Through A Songline’ run by the Australian Consulate-General Bengaluru. Walking Through A Songline is an award-winning digital immersive art installation which explores the nexus between ancient Australian First Nations knowledge and cutting-edge technology, created by Mosster Studio for the National Museum of Australia.

Credits: A Screen Australia and National Indigenous Television (NITV) initiative
